title: 112_hr1447
content: The "Aviation Security Stakeholder Participation Act of 2012" may be cited as the Aviation Security Advisory Committee. The "Aviation Security Advisory Committee" is established within the Transportation Security Administration to advise on aviation security matters and develop recommendations for improvements. The Advisory Committee develops recommendations for aviation security improvements and submits periodic reports to the Assistant Secretary. The Advisory Committee submits periodic reports to the Assistant Secretary on matters identified by the Assistant Secretary or a majority of the members. An annual report is also provided on activities, findings, and recommendations from the previous year. Membership appointments must be made within 180 days of the section's enactment. The Advisory Committee, including its working groups, provides information on activities, findings, and recommendations from the previous year. Membership consists of representatives from up to 27 member organizations, including air carriers, all cargo air transportation, indirect air carriers, and labor. The Advisory Committee consists of representatives from various organizations in the aviation industry, including air carriers, cargo air transportation, labor unions, aircraft manufacturers, airport operators, general aviation, privacy, the travel industry, and aviation technology security. Members do not receive compensation and can be removed for cause by the Assistant Secretary. The Assistant Secretary may review and remove Advisory Committee members for cause at any time. Members do not receive compensation and must meet at least semiannually. An air cargo security working group within the Advisory Committee provides recommendations on air cargo security issues. The Assistant Secretary may convene additional meetings as necessary. An air cargo security working group within the Advisory Committee provides recommendations on air cargo security issues, including the implementation of air cargo security programs. The working group meets quarterly and submits recommendations to improve the Administration's cargo screening mandates. The working group meets quarterly to discuss air cargo security and submits recommendations to improve cargo security initiatives. The group includes members with expertise in air cargo operations and is cochaired by a Government and industry official. Additionally, a general aviation security working group provides recommendations on transportation security issues. The Assistant Secretary establishes a general aviation security working group within the Advisory Committee to provide recommendations on transportation security issues for general aviation facilities, aircraft, and helicopter operations at airports. The working group meets quarterly, includes members of the Advisory Committee, and submits information on aviation security to be included in the annual report. The Assistant Secretary establishes a perimeter security working group within the Advisory Committee to provide recommendations on airport perimeter security and access control issues. The working group, cochaired by a Government and industry official, meets quarterly and includes members with expertise in general aviation. The Assistant Secretary establishes an airport perimeter security working group within the Advisory Committee. The group meets quarterly, includes members with expertise in airport security, and is cochaired by a Government and industry official. The Assistant Secretary establishes an airport perimeter security working group within the Advisory Committee. The group includes members with expertise in airport perimeter security and access control issues, cochaired by a Government and industry official. The Federal Advisory Committee Act does not apply to the Advisory Committee or its working groups. Definitions for Advisory Committee, annual report, and Assistant Secretary are provided in this section. The Aviation Security Advisory Committee, established by the Assistant Secretary of Homeland Security, includes an airport perimeter security working group. Perimeter security involves monitoring and securing airport areas to prevent unauthorized access. The Aviation Security Advisory Committee was passed by the House of Representatives on June 28, 2012.
